elements.title: Computational design of metallohydrolases
elements.contents:
Computational design of metallohydrolases

A generative artificial intelligence-powered method enables de novo design of highly active enzymes based on information about the geometry of residues in the active site, without requiring protein backbone or sequence information.

  • Donghyo Kim
  • Seth M. Woodbury
  • David Baker
ArticleOpen Access03 Dec 2025

elements.title: A place-based assessment of biodiversity intactness in sub-Saharan Africa
elements.contents:
A place-based assessment of biodiversity intactness in sub-Saharan Africa

Regional, place-based biodiversity information is used to comprehensively map and quantify biodiversity intactness of sub-Saharan Africa to inform national and global sustainability policies and planning.

  • Hayley S. Clements
  • Reinette Biggs
  • Andrew L. Skowno
ArticleOpen Access03 Dec 2025

elements.title: Sterile-neutrino search based on 259 days of KATRIN data
elements.contents:
Sterile-neutrino search based on 259 days of KATRIN data

The analysis of the energy spectrum of 36 million tritium β-decay electrons recorded in 259 measurement days within the last 40 eV below the endpoint challenges the Neutrino-4 claim.

  • H. Acharya
  • M. Aker
  • G. Zeller
ArticleOpen Access03 Dec 2025

elements.title: Whole-genome landscapes of 1,364 breast cancers
elements.contents:
Whole-genome landscapes of 1,364 breast cancers

Whole-genome and transcriptome analysis of 1,364 cases of breast cancer from South Korea broadens our understanding of breast cancer biology and reveals genomic features that connect tumour biology with treatment responses and clinical outcomes.

  • Ryul Kim
  • Jonghan Yu
  • Yeon Hee Park
ArticleOpen Access03 Dec 2025

elements.title: Modelling late gastrulation in stem cell-derived monkey embryo models
elements.contents:
Modelling late gastrulation in stem cell-derived monkey embryo models

An optimized 3D culture system enabled a stem cell-derived monkey blastoid to develop to day 25, recapitulating key events of primate late gastrula and demonstrating notable similarity to natural embryos.

  • Jie Li
  • Jie Li
  • Zhen Liu
Article03 Dec 2025

elements.title: Dated gene duplications elucidate the evolutionary assembly of eukaryotes
elements.contents:
Dated gene duplications elucidate the evolutionary assembly of eukaryotes

Analysis of eukaryotic gene sequences using a relaxed molecular clock methodology indicate that eukaryotes emerged 3.0–2.25 billion years ago as a result of mitochondrial endosymbiosis with complex archaea that already possessed an elaborated cytoskeleton, membrane trafficking, endomembrane, phagocytotic machinery and a nucleus.

  • Christopher J. Kay
  • Anja Spang
  • Philip C. J. Donoghue
ArticleOpen Access03 Dec 2025

elements.title: TSC tunes progenitor balance and upper-layer neuron generation in neocortex
elements.contents:
TSC tunes progenitor balance and upper-layer neuron generation in neocortex

The balance between radial progenitors and intermediate precursors to generate upper-layer neurons during the development and evolution of the cerebral cortex is mediated by members of the tuberous sclerosis complex.

  • Cristine R. Casingal
  • Naoki Nakagawa
  • E. S. Anton
Article03 Dec 2025

elements.title: The Microflora Danica atlas of Danish environmental microbiomes
elements.contents:
The Microflora Danica atlas of Danish environmental microbiomes

Microflora Danica—an atlas of Danish environmental microbiomes—reveals that although human-disturbed habitats have high alpha diversity, species reoccur, revealing hidden homogeneity.

  • C. M. Singleton
  • T. B. N. Jensen
  • M. Albertsen
ArticleOpen Access03 Dec 2025

elements.title: Determination of the spin and parity of all-charm tetraquarks
elements.contents:
Determination of the spin and parity of all-charm tetraquarks

The CMS Collaboration reports the measurement of the spin, parity, and charge conjugation properties of all-charm tetraquarks, exotic fleeting particles formed in proton–proton collisions at the Large Hadron Collider.

  • A. Hayrapetyan
  • V. Makarenko
  • A. Snigirev
ArticleOpen Access03 Dec 2025

elements.title: Satellite megaconstellations will threaten space-based astronomy
elements.contents:
Satellite megaconstellations will threaten space-based astronomy

Rapidly growing satellite constellations pose a substantial threat to astronomical observations, with projections indicating that future space telescopes will have more than 96% of their exposures affected by satellite trails, necessitating urgent mitigation strategies.

  • Alejandro S. Borlaff
  • Pamela M. Marcum
  • Steve B. Howell
ArticleOpen Access03 Dec 2025

elements.title: Computational enzyme design by catalytic motif scaffolding
elements.contents:
Computational enzyme design by catalytic motif scaffolding

A hybrid machine learning and atomistic modelling strategy enables one-shot design of efficient enzymes to catalyse diverse biological and non-biological chemical transformations.

  • Markus Braun
  • Adrian Tripp
  • Gustav Oberdorfer
ArticleOpen Access03 Dec 2025

elements.title: Built environment disparities are amplified during extreme weather recovery
elements.contents:
Built environment disparities are amplified during extreme weather recovery

Higher-income neighbourhoods rebuild and improve after disasters while lower-income areas do not return to pre-disaster conditions.

  • Tianyuan Huang
  • Chad Zanocco
  • Ram Rajagopal
Article03 Dec 2025

elements.title: Video-call glitches trigger uncanniness and harm consequential life outcomes
elements.contents:
Video-call glitches trigger uncanniness and harm consequential life outcomes

Glitches in video calls can have a negative effect on the judgement of the people involved and correspond to worse outcomes in major areas of life such as job interviews and parole hearings.

  • Melanie S. Brucks
  • Jacqueline R. Rifkin
  • Jeff S. Johnson
Article03 Dec 2025

elements.title: Search for light sterile neutrinos with two neutrino beams at MicroBooNE
elements.contents:
Search for light sterile neutrinos with two neutrino beams at MicroBooNE

Data obtained from the MicroBooNE liquid-argon time projection chamber are used to exclude the single light sterile neutrino interpretation of the LSND and MiniBooNE anomalies at the 95% confidence level.

  • P. Abratenko
  • D. Andrade Aldana
  • C. Zhang
ArticleOpen Access03 Dec 2025

elements.title: Viral RNA blocks circularization to evade host codon usage control
elements.contents:
Viral RNA blocks circularization to evade host codon usage control

Rather than adapting to the codon usage of their host, viruses use viral 5′ untranslated regions to initiate translation, which allows them to produce viral proteins in host cells efficiently despite poor codon usage profiles.

  • Huan Liu
  • Jiabin Duan
  • Yi Liu
Article03 Dec 2025

elements.title: Homo sapiens-specific evolution unveiled by ancient southern African genomes
elements.contents:
Homo sapiens-specific evolution unveiled by ancient southern African genomes

The genomes of 28 ancient southern African individuals dated to between 10,200 and 150 years before present offer insights into the evolution of Homo sapiens.

  • Mattias Jakobsson
  • Carolina Bernhardsson
  • Carina M. Schlebusch
ArticleOpen Access03 Dec 2025

elements.title: Architecture of the neutrophil compartment
elements.contents:
Architecture of the neutrophil compartment

Mapping of the neutrophil compartment using single-cell transcriptional data from multiple physiological and patological states reveals its organizational architecture and how cell state dynamics and trajectories vary during health, inflammation and cancer.

  • Daniela Cerezo-Wallis
  • Andrea Rubio-Ponce
  • Iván Ballesteros
ArticleOpen Access03 Dec 2025

elements.title: Decay of driver mutations shapes the landscape of intestinal transformation
elements.contents:
Decay of driver mutations shapes the landscape of intestinal transformation

The order in which driver mutations of colorectal cancer occur in intestinal epithelium can determine whether clones are positively or negatively selected and can shape subsequent tumour development.

  • Filipe C. Lourenço
  • Iannish D. Sadien
  • Douglas J. Winton
ArticleOpen Access03 Dec 2025

elements.title: Bulk superconductivity up to 96 K in pressurized nickelate single crystals
elements.contents:
Bulk superconductivity up to 96 K in pressurized nickelate single crystals

  • Feiyu Li
  • Zhenfang Xing
  • Junjie Zhang
Article02 Dec 2025

elements.title: CD8+ T cell stemness precedes post-intervention control of HIV viremia
elements.contents:
CD8+ T cell stemness precedes post-intervention control of HIV viremia

  • Zahra Kiani
  • Jonathan M. Urbach
  • David R. Collins
Article01 Dec 2025
